intro: Nardosmia hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's nardosmia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, pleasant fragrance. Nardosmia hookeriana is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
